meanings.definition: A seam or ridge in an organ or tissue.
meanings.sent1: The rhaphes in the skin help hold everything together.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon carefully stitched the rhaphes after the operation.
meanings.sent3: The rhaphes in the fabric made the shirt look unique.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range resembled a series of rhaphes on the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The rhaphes in the tree bark created an interesting pattern.

meanings.definition: A type of suture used in surgery.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used rhaphes to close the wound.
meanings.sent2: The nurse handed the surgeon the rhaphes for the procedure.
meanings.sent3: The rhaphes were so tiny, they looked like little ants on the skin.
meanings.sent4: The rhaphes worked like magic to bring the skin back together.
meanings.sent5: The patient felt relieved when the rhaphes were in place.

meanings.definition: A line or ridge on a plant or animal.
meanings.sent1: The rhaphes on the leaf gave it a unique texture.
meanings.sent2: The cat's fur had rhaphes running along its back.
meanings.sent3: The rhaphes on the snake's skin looked like tiny mountains.
meanings.sent4: The rhaphes on the bird's feathers shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The rhaphes on the tree trunk provided grip for the squirrel.
